quizDescription.text:
A event is a subset of the sample space.
  • Single coin flip: (Event that a coin lands head) A = {H}.
  • Double coin flip: (Event that first coin lands head) A = {(H, H),(H,T)}.
  • Single dice roll: (Event that the dice roll is less than 4) A = {1, 2, 3}.
  • Double dice roll: (Event that the dice roll add up to less than 4) A = {(1, 1),(1, 2),(2, 1)}

The collection of all such events we would like to consider are called the set of events, F. F is a σ-algebra. Ω ∈ F.
  • F is closed under complementation.
  • F is closed under countable unions.
